Me too.  Unfortunately, 2-channel audio doesn't work well for action movies at all.  The speaking is muted compared to the action scenes.

No nfo was provided from YIFY per usual, and there is pretty bad audio per usual as well, but not as bad of audio as in The Amazing Spiderman 720p by YIFY.  Here is some nfo as provided to me by Mediainfo.  You will notice that the video is fine, but the audio is only 4% of the total size, and the video is 95%.  I certainly think a couple hundred megabytes more of audio would make this upload considerably better, potentially changing the bitrate from 92kbps to 320kbps or 384kbps and changing it from 2-channel to 6-channel without adding that much in the way of size.  I donâ€™t think people would complain with this upload being 2.2 or 2.3gb vs 2gb with the slight size increase coming with a substantial improvement in audio.

For cinavia playback on PS3, use "PS3 Media Server" and store the files on your pc. If you have a wireless network you can stream a cinavia file to your PS3, and it encodes it for normal playback while you watch. Done it multiples times and works like a charm. Hope that helps!

It's pretty easy to get around Cinivia on PS3
1) When it mutes do not panic :)
2) Go to >Settings >Time settings (or whatever)
3) Change the year by 15+ years
4) Repeat after it mutes again 20 minutes later...usually 2-4 times

djbuddha, someone acquires a BrRip weeks before they are released into stores, and then all the uploaders get their hands on it and compress it in all the various ways. The dvdrip is usually acquired a few days to a few weeks prior to the BrRip.

It has been quite a while, but if I recall correctly:

Avengers - BrRip 2 weeks in advance.
Hunger Games - 5 weeks.
Amazing Spiderman - 2 weeks.
Expendables 2 - 6 weeks.
Prometheus - 2 weeks.

2 methods to get this working on a PS3 without Cinivia or at least workaround:

 1: Use "PS3 Media Server" (PS3, Wi-Fi or Ethernet and PC needed)
and store the files on your pc. If you have a wireless network you can stream a cinavia file to your PS3, and it encodes it for normal playback while you watch.

 2: Get around Cinivia on PS3 (Manual PS3 Needed Only)

1) When it mutes do not panic.
2) Go to >Settings >Time settings
3) Change the year by 15+ years
4) Repeat after it mutes again 20 minutes later (Depending on movie length = 2 Hours = 6 Times to do this quick 10 second method.
